author: Paul Hudson
title: Goodwood 75th Members' Meeting Preview
text:
Goodwood 75th Members' Meeting Preview David Coulthard returns to the track at Goodwood this weekend Credit: Geoff Pugh Paul Hudson 14 March 2017 • 12:32pm 
D avid Coulthard is the the latest addition to the star-studded driver line-up at this weekend’s 75th Members’ Meeting at the Goodwood Motor Circuit. 
The Scot, a 13-time Grand Prix winner turned F1 commentator, will be racing a 1955 Mercedes 300 SL 417 on the Saturday of the event at midday - and you'll be able to watch all the racing action action here on the Telegraph Cars website. 
Other famous drivers racing in 12 races across the weekend include: Andrew Jordan, 2013 BTCC champion (Mini 1275 GT); Gerhard Berger, 10-time Grand Prix winner (Ford Capri Mk3 3.0S); Tom Kristensen, nine-time Le Mans winner (Rover 3500 SD1); Gordon Shedden, reigning BTCC champion (Rover 3500 SD1); Matt Neal, three-time BTCC champion (Chevrolet Camaro Z28); Roberto Ravaglia, European and World Touring Car Champion (Ford Capri 3.0S); touring car legend Steve Soper (Triumph Dolomite Sprint); Stig Blomqvist, 1984 World Rally champion (Mini 1275 GT); and Rob Huff, former World Touring Car champion, who will be driving another Ford Capri Mk3 3.0S. The daffodils are out so it's officially spring - and the Goodwood Members' Meeting Credit: Drew Gibson 
G oodwood Members’ Meeting House Captains Nicolas Minassian, Emanuele Pirro, Jochen Mass and Anthony Reid will once again be battling it out on the track for points for their respective Houses. 
Away from the racing action, Goodwood Road Racing Club members and their guests can take part in a range of activities including an air rifle range, jeep driving and ferret racing, while enjoying delicious food and drink. An open-to-all party culminating in spectacular fireworks will take place on the Saturday evening. 
The Goodwood Members’ Meeting is a packed weekend of motor racing founded by Lord March, which aims to recreate the atmosphere and camaraderie of the original BARC Members’ Meetings held at Goodwood throughout the Fifties and Sixties until the circuit closed for racing in 1966. 
T he event features all kinds of cars from classic tin-tops and GTs to classic Formula 1 cars and historic motorcycles, as well as high-speed demonstration runs featuring significant competition cars, aiming to offer visitors a friendly and intimate atmosphere with no crowds.
